page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: FARMING IS THE ONLY INDUSTRY IN THIS AREA. ONE FARMER ON THE LOWER REACHES HAS A LARGE DAIRY HERD, BUT THE MAJORITY BREED BEEF CATTLE. BECAUSE OF THE TERRAIN SHEEP BREEDING IS PREDOMINANT, HARDY SPECKLED-FACED HILL SHEEP, KERRYS, CLUNS, SUFFOLK RAMS AND SUFFOLK CROSS-BRED EWES. HORSES ARE KEPT FOR PLEASURE. ANIMALS ARE SOLD BY AUCTION AT HEREFORD MARKET, KINGTON, OR AT A NEW MARKET AT KINNERTON. THERE IS ROTATION OF CROPS, SPRING AND WINTER BARLEY AND GRASS CONVERTED TO SILEAGE FOR WINTER FODDER. FARMERS DEPEND ON CONTRACTORS FOR SILEAGE AND FOR SHEARING. SALE OF WOOL IS A CLOSED MARKET TO THE ENGLISH/WELSH WOOL MARKETING BOARDS.MAINLY THE WHOLE FAMILY IS INVOLVED. PART OF THE AREA RECEIVES THE EEC SUBSIDY.
